original: Holden, Åndreas Hainiseni, civilingenjör, disponent, Diö, f. 28/10/71 i Te|lemarken, Norge, av agron. Peder Hansen o. Lise Halvorsdotter. G. 99 m. Linnea Wikman. Barn: Leif f. 00, Fred 01, Thoralf 02, Finn 06. — Stud:ex., utex. fr. CTI (V) 94, stud. v. Chemnitz Papierwarenfabr., stud:-res. t. TyskL, Engl., Frankr., Ryssk o. USA. Ing:assist. v. Skottfors Pap-persfabr. 95-97, ing. o. förste verk-mäst. v. Kuusankoski Pappersfabr. A-B i Kouvo’la, Finl., 97-98, driftsing. v. Långeds Pappersbruk 98-08, konstr. o. driftsing. v. A-B Skellefteå Trä-massefabr. 08-16, disp. o. verkst. dir. f. Gemla Fabrikers A-B i Diö sed. 16. Utfört dammbyggn. v. Skaftet i Västervik, uppf. Skellefteå Trämassefabr. i Ursviken m. m. Inneh. ett flert. patent inom pappers-, cellulosa- o. trämaisseomir. RVO, PatrGM.
translated: Holden, Åndreas Hainiseni, an engineer, manager, from Diö, born on October 28, 1871 in Telemarken, Norway to Peder Hansen, an agronomist, and Lise Halvorsdotter. Married in 1899 to Linnea Wikman. Children: Leif born in 1900, Fred born in 1901, Thoralf born in 1902 and Finn born in 1906. Holden completed his secondary education in 1894 and studied at Chemnitz Papierwarenfabr. He also did study visits in Germany, England, France, Russia, and the USA. He worked as an engineering assistant at Skottfors Papersfabr. from 1895-1897, then as an engineer and chief technician at Kuusankoski Pappersfabr. A-B in Kouvo'la, Finland, from 1897-1898. From 1898-1908 he was the chief engineer at Långeds Pappersbruk. He then did design and engineering work from 1908-1916 at A-B Skellefteå Trä-massefabr. and became the manager and CEO of Gemla Fabrikers A-B in Diö since 1916. Holden has built dams in Skaftet in Västervik and established Skellefteå Trämassefabr. in Ursviken, among other things. He holds several patents in the paper, cellulose, and timber industries. Holden was awarded the Order of the Vasa (RVO) and the Patent Gold Medal (PatrGM).
